Description: Restored rim and floor fragments of an East Greek black-figured pottery plate with tall sofa rim. Guilloche on top of lip; on floor, from the outside: meander frieze; frieze of alternating groups of strokes and filled squares; frieze of animals, a bull and lion preserved, to left; then part of central floral motif. White slip(?).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

From the same vessel as Boston MFA 88.841 and 88.966 and Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1925.608c. Published in Walter-Karydi, Samos VI.1, 1973, 139 no. 731, pl. 97.731 (see Walter-Karydi, Samos VI.1, 1973, 139 no. 731, pl. 97.731, erroneously classified as Chian). Özer 2004, 200, classifies the plate as transitional between LWG and black-figure and dates it to 570-60BC. Özer, B. 2004, ‘Clazomenian and related black-figured pottery from Klazomenai: preliminary observations’, in A.Moustaka,E.Skarlatidou,M.-C.Tzannes,Y.Ersoy (Eds), Klazomenai, Teos and Abdera:Metropoleis and Colony,Thessaloniki, 199–219.Özer, B. 2004, ‘Clazomenian and related black-figured pottery from Klazomenai: preliminary observations’, in A. Moustaka, E. Skarlatidou, M.-C. Tzannes,Y. Ersoy (eds), Klazomenai, Teos and Abdera: Metropoleis and Colony,Thessaloniki, 199–219.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 215, no. 43)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 102, pl. XXX, no. 308.2)
